nameEntry.part: Shastri Indo-Canadian Institute. University of Alberta Chapter

biogHist.p: The Shastri Indo-Canadian Institute, established in 1968, seeks to build academic and cultural links between India and Canada, to foster mutual understanding, and to promote Canadian studies in India. To this end it supports fellowships in India and Canada, a Visiting Scholar Program, workshops, seminars and conferences, a library development program, and cultural and academic exchanges. The Institute is supported by the governments of Canada and India. Chapters have been established at 14 Canadian universities. The Board of Directors includes the High Commissioner for India and a representative from the National Library of Canada.
